title: Pull request merge from lesteve/nilearn:find-xyz-cuts-api to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
Could you:
- Add the function in plotting/**init**.py: let's make it public, it's useful
- Add it in doc/modules/references.rst

Have to use such a high tolerance to get the test to pass. Here is the error with rtol=4e-2

Not equal to tolerance rtol=0.04, atol=0

(mismatch 100.0%)
x: array([ 49.5, 9.5, 39.5])
y: array([50, 10, 40])

In nilearn/plotting/find_cuts.py: > ``` > """ Find the center of the largest activation connected component. > > Parameters > ----------- > ``` > - data : 3D ndarray > - The activation map, as a 3D numpy array. > - img : 3D Nifti1Image > - The activation map data. > Maybe: The statistical map to be displayed — Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/plotting/find_cuts.py')

text:
Change nilearn.plotting.find_cuts.find_xyz_cut_coords to take a niimg as argument and return world, rather than voxel, coordinates
Add a test for non-trivial affine
Minor whitespace tweak while I was touching the file
Make find_xyz_cut_coords accessible from nilearn.plotting and add it to the reference doc
